headline: A Dimmer and a Motion Sensor
description: A new phase in the BathyBeacon prototype: integrating both analog dimming and a motion sensor to simulate a responsive bioluminescent beacon. Notes, photos, and philosophy in tandem.
timeFelt: Evening workshop clarity; a fusion of precision and poetic reflection
whyItMatters: This post marks the beginning of layered interaction in the prototype—where light and sensing converge. A symbol of future living technologies adapting in real time.
articleExcerpt: I added a potentiometer and a motion sensor to the LED circuit today. It dimmed exactly as I imagined, but the most magical part was when the sensor caught movement and brought light forth like a creature noticing you...
sourceFragments: Wired the sensor to pin 7 and the dimmer to A0
Behavior reminds me of anemones or jellyfish pulsing in response to proximity
This feels like the beginning of interaction, not just automation
